nodes.text: Force-sculpture was a form of art which consisted in producing three-dimensional figures, manipulating matter through the Force. Towards the end of the Republic Era, the Jedi Master Veleckra taught Force-sculpture at the Jedi Temple on Coruscant. The Duros Jedi Master Wishan was also a Force sculptor, using dark red clay to fashion a variety of figures, such as a greater krayt dragon, a tower, a replica Jedi Temple, and even a statuette representing the young Jedi Jabe Rann, complete with a lightsaber.

Force-sculpture first appeared in Dooku: Jedi Lost, a 2019 audiodrama written by Cavan Scott. The art form was first pictured in the first episode of Star Wars: Jedi Temple Challenge during an animated flashback sequence also written by Scott.
